bill_title: partially reallocate federal payments from national forests.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to partially reallocate federal payments from national forests. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 41-16-11 be AMENDED: 41-16-11. AllNinety percent of the money received from the forest service of the United States under the Agricultural Act approved June 30, 1906, as receipts from the Black Hills National Forest, shall be is distributed annually to the counties of Lawrence, Meade, Pennington, Custer, and Fall River, for the benefit of the public roads and public schools of such counties, in proportion to the area of such Black Hills National Forest in each county. The remaining money is used to fund the Native American achievement schools grant program established under § 1-54-13. Section 2. That § 41-16-12 be AMENDED: 41-16-12. AllNinety percent of the money received by the state treasurer as a percentage of the gross receipts, from the Custer National Forest shall be is annually paid to Harding County for the benefit of the public roads and public schools of such county. The remaining money is transferred to the local infrastructure improvement grant fund established under § 1-16G-50 and reserved for tribal governments.

action_log.status_text: Withdrawn at the Request of the Prime Sponsor
